description.raw:
* Added fc_tc_parse.py to resolve mapping from team->round->world->tc values

* added hacky `/sim` route for FC to access team name and round number from Sim instance in order to utilize the fc_tc_parse.py. The sim instance posts to the `/sim` route that saves the data to `/tmp/sim_data`, and the FC instances curls the route to get that data

The TC mapping files are: `tcFile` and `teamRoundMappingFile`. They should be manually added to the `cloudsim-sim/src_commands` directory

Example `tcFile`:

~~~
World,T1 latency,T1 uplink,T1 downlink,T2_3 latency,T2_3 uplink,T2_3 downlink
1,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
2,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
3,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
4,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
5,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
~~~

example `teamRoundMappingFile`

~~~
Team,Round 1,Round 2,Round 3,Round 4,Round 5
SRC-debug,5,4,3,2,1
~~~
description.html:
• Added fc_tc_parse.py to resolve mapping from team->round->world->tc values

  • added hacky /sim route for FC to access team name and round number from Sim instance in order to utilize the fc_tc_parse.py. The sim instance posts to the /sim route that saves the data to /tmp/sim_data, and the FC instances curls the route to get that data

The TC mapping files are: tcFile and teamRoundMappingFile. They should be manually added to the cloudsim-sim/src_commands directory

Example tcFile:

World,T1 latency,T1 uplink,T1 downlink,T2_3 latency,T2_3 uplink,T2_3 downlink
1,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
2,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
3,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
4,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
5,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit

example teamRoundMappingFile

Team,Round 1,Round 2,Round 3,Round 4,Round 5
SRC-debug,5,4,3,2,1
